title: Blocked URL
content:
There is one domain that I get a "server not found" error for even after doing many things to fix it including everything here, https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/firefox-cant-load-websites-other-browsers-can#firefox:win10:fx119, checking blocked URLs in the registry, running malware checks, safe mode, reinstalling FF after removing all FF folders from my system.

Before I did a completely clean reinstall, disabling the Open H264 codec (see attached screenshot) would allow me to access the site. But thinking it was needed, I did the clean reinstall. Now disabling it does not allow access to the site.

So far, I have not found any other websites with this problem. It's a .edu domain which happens to be the one I work for! What else can I do?
creator: lifespan

title: Scrollbar jumps up in phpbb so can't see what i'm writing when messages get longer
content:
The title pretty much says it. On some phpBB forum I am member of, since yesterday, I can't write long messages and see what I'm writing.

When my texte is bigger than the default frame, the scrollbar jumps at the top of the post while i'm still writing. This doesn't happen with other browers on same webpage.

Possibility : the deepl addon i just installed  ?

Any idea ?

(sorry if i'm not clear enough, english is not my first language)
creator: pdelune

title: localhost slow only in Firefox
content:
as a a developer i use localhost often. However, a few weeks ago firefox started becoming very slow on localhost. I start a project and try to access it at localhost, but it takes a very long time to do the "initial load". then it works fast for a little while, and then its like it have to reload everything and that take a long time.

I have tried opening a private window to disable all my extensions, but without luck. I have tried checking my hosts file but found nothing wrong there. I have tried opening same localhost in Safari, but that works normally (fast).

I have checked online but found almost nothing, and the few things i found couldnt solve my issue. I hope there is a solution because this is a problem for me every day.
creator: theodorkier

title: Hardare accelerated downscaling of non fullscreen video
content:
When I have my videos not in fullscreen, they are really pixelated and look terrible (YouTube), but when I set them to fullscreen, they're excellent. My monitor uses 1440p, but I have the videos set to 4K to get the best bit rate and image quality. The non fullscreen view in YouTube's default view is 720p, so the videos look really pixelated.

Is there a way to turn on hardware down-scaling for this, so it looks better? Whenever I change the size of video and image sources in OBS, I can choose the scale filtering between bicubic and some others to get it to look better, and it looks like nothing is happening at all in Firefox when videos are not in fullscreen.

I COULD change resolution between having the video fullscreen and not, but that is just really annoying to do 100 times a day.
creator: AlexaRex

title: Can't Edit Autofill Phone Number
content:
Firefox autofill saves my phone number with a +1.

In other words instead of saving my phone number as 555-555-5555 it saves it as +1555-555-555. Of course this is rejected by 99.999% of the forms on the web making this part of the autofill useless. So I go to edit it by removing the +1 and save. It appears to save fine but when I look at it the +1 is back again.

Why the stupidity and and why not let me edit it to whatever I want?
creator: whatatay
